cultural_context.interview_structure: Competency-focused, less hierarchical than other African markets, panel or one-on-one formats

panel_introductions.text: Good morning. I'm [Name], [Title]. Thanks for making the time to see us today. We'll get straight into it - we have about [time] allocated for this interview.
Welcome. I'm [Name] and this is [Name] from [Department]. We're here to learn more about you and your experience. Feel free to be direct and honest with your answers.

Thanks for coming in. I'm [Name], and I'll be leading today's discussion. We're particularly interested in understanding your competencies and how they align with this role. Let's start with you telling us a bit about yourself.

Good morning. I'm [Name], and with me is [Name]. As you know, we're committed to transformation and diversity in our organization. We'd like to understand how you see yourself contributing to our goals.
Howzit! Thanks for coming through. I'm [Name], [Title]. Let's have a chat about your background and what you're looking for in your next role.

metadata.research_notes: Based on interview experiences from major South African employers including Standard Bank, MTN, Sasol, Nedbank, FNB, Discovery, Vodacom, and Capitec. SA interviews emphasize direct communication, confidence, diversity consciousness (BEE/Transformation), and competency demonstration. Less hierarchical than Nigeria, more direct than Kenya. Ubuntu philosophy and transformation awareness are key cultural markers.
